qas.question: In Janurary of 2014, what was the population of Paris' city limits?
Where is Paris ranked in the EU by largest municipality?
What 4 cities are larger than Paris in the EU?
Who created The Paris Urban Area?
According to the INSEE what is Paris Urban Area population?

context: The population of Paris in its administrative city limits was <a0_0>2,241,346<a0_0/> in January 2014. This makes Paris the <a1_0>fifth<a1_0/> largest municipality in the European Union, following <a2_0>London, Berlin, Madrid and Rome<a2_0/>. Eurostat, the statistical agency of the EU, places Paris (6.5 million people) second behind London (8 million) and ahead of Berlin (3.5 million), based on the 2012 populations of what Eurostat calls "urban audit core cities". The Paris Urban Area, or "unité urbaine", is a statistical area created by the French statistical agency <a3_0>INSEE<a3_0/> to measure the population of built-up areas around the city. It is slightly smaller than the Paris Region. According to INSEE, the Paris Urban Area had a population of <a4_0>10,550,350<a4_0/> at the January 2012 census, the most populous in the European Union, and third most populous in Europe, behind Istanbul and Moscow. The Paris Metropolitan Area is the second most populous in the European Union after London with a population of 12,341,418 at the Jan. 2012 census.
